info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:48AM MDT until June 29 at 1:15AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT FOR CENTRAL YUMA COUNTY... At 1248 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Eckley, or 9 miles east of Yuma, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported ping pong ball size hail on Highway 34 near Yuma at 1241 AM MDT. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Wray and Eckley. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 237 and 258. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
